      • k_select

        public static int k_select(int[] arr,
                           int k)
        k-select function Returns the k-th smallest element in an array Runs in linear time, variant of Quicksort
        Parameters:
        arr - The input array
        k - The index of the element in the sorted array to return k starts at 0, so k_select(arr, 0) will return the minimum element.
        Returns:
        The k-th smallest element of the input array

      • sort

        public static int[] sort(int[] arr)
        Sort function Sorts an array of integers (currently using mergesort)
        Parameters:
        arr - The array of elements
        Returns:
        A sorted version of the array

      • sort_merge

        public static int[] sort_merge(int[] arr)
        Mergesort function Sorts an array of integers using mergesort
        Parameters:
        arr - The array of elements
        Returns:
        A sorted version of the array, using mergesort

      • subarray

        public static int[] subarray(int[] arr,
                             int begin,
                             int end)
        Subarray function returns a subarray of a given array, starting at the begin index and ending at the end index (exclusive)
        Parameters:
        arr - The array of elements
        begin - The beginning index of the subarray in the original array
        end - The ending index of the subarray in the original array
        Returns:
        A new array consisting of elements between the beginning and ending index of the original array

      • swap

        public static void swap(int[] arr,
                        int a,
                        int b)
        swap function swaps two elements in an array in-place
        Parameters:
        arr - The array of elements
        a - The first index of an element to swap
        b - The second index of an element to swap
